thread.title: SAP Profit Lifted by Cloud Subscriptions
thread.title_full: SAP Profit Lifted by Cloud Subscriptions

author: morningstar.com
title: SAP Profit Lifted by Cloud Subscriptions
text:
FRANKFURT—German business software provider SAP SE on Tuesday said it had posted a 2% rise in net profit for the third quarter, helped by new subscriptions for its Internet cloud-based products.
Net profit for the period ended Sept. 30 was €898 million, compared with €880 million during the same period last year.
The company also provided a net profit figure of €1.17 billion based on calculations that aren't recognized under international financial reporting standards. Analysts had predicted a non-IFRS net profit of €1.09 billion for the quarter, according to a recent poll conducted by The Wall Street Journal.
"Clearly the third quarter is a beat," said Chief Executive Bill McDermott, suggesting that the company had a chance to "outrun" its guidance for the full year.
SAP last week reiterated its outlook for fiscal year 2015, saying its expects full-year non-IFRS cloud subscriptions and support revenue to be in a range of €1.95 billion to €2.05 billion at constant currencies. Full year non-IFRS operating profit should be in a range of €5.6 billion to €5.9 billion at constant currencies.
SAP pre-released some of its third quarter figures last week, reporting a 5% increase in the company's closely watched operating profit, to €1.21 billion. Total revenue rose by 17% to €4.98 billion, buoyed by strong growth in the cloud and a solid uptake of new on-premise software licenses. Cloud subscriptions and support revenue increased by over 100% to €599 million year-over-year.
Write to Christopher Alessi at christopher.alessi@wsj.com
